title: Effect of an FXR1 mutation on gene expression

content.description:
Read each question carefully. Write your response in the space provided for each part of each question. Answers must be written out in paragraph form. Outlines, bulleted lists, or diagrams alone are not acceptable and will not be scored.

Atherosclerosis is a disease that results when certain cells and proteins of an individual’s body adhere to and damage blood vessels, especially those around the heart. Researchers continue to look for improved ways to treat individuals with the disease. Data obtained from earlier experiments suggested that it might be possible to reduce damage to the blood vessels by increasing the expression of <math alttext="F X R 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>FXR1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, an <math alttext="R N A" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>RNA</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>-binding protein in the muscle cells that form the outer surface of the blood vessels. Additional data suggested that <math alttext="I L 19" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>IL-19</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, a protein secreted by certain white blood cells, might regulate expression of the <math alttext="F X R 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi><mi>X</mi><mi mathvariant="italic">R</mi><mtext mathvariant="italic">1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> gene.

To investigate the regulation of the <math alttext="F X R 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi><mi>X</mi><mi mathvariant="italic">R</mi><mtext mathvariant="italic">1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> gene by <math alttext="I L 19" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>IL-19</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, a researcher added <math alttext="I L 19" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>IL-19</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to vessel-lining muscle cells growing in the lab. The researcher measured the amount of <math alttext="F X R 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>FXR1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> protein produced by the cells over a period of <math alttext="48" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>48</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> hours in the presence of <math alttext="I L 19" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>IL-19</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. The researcher then calculated the relative amount of <math alttext="F X R 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>FXR1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> present at each time point compared with the amount of <math alttext="F X R 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>FXR1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> at Time <math alttext="0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, when <math alttext="I L 19" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>IL-19</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> was first added to the cells. Data from three replicate experiments are shown in Table <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

TABLE 1. RELATIVE AMOUNT OF <math alttext="F X R 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>FXR1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> PRODUCED BY CELLS IN RESPONSE TO <math alttext="I L 19" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>IL-19</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

Time in the Presence of <math alttext="I L 19" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>IL-19</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> (h)

content.question: (a) Describe how amino acids are categorized by their chemical properties. Explain how a change in the amino acid sequence of the <math alttext="F X R 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>FXR1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> protein could decrease the ability of the protein to bind to <math alttext="R N A" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>RNA</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>.

frqParts.text: (a) Describe how amino acids are categorized by their chemical properties. Explain how a change in the amino acid sequence of the <math alttext="F X R 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>FXR1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> protein could decrease the ability of the protein to bind to <math alttext="R N A" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>RNA</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>.

(b) Using the template in the space provided for your response, construct an appropriately labeled graph that represents the data shown in Table <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Determine whether there is a statistical difference in the amount of <math alttext="F X R 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>FXR1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> protein produced by the cells after <math alttext="16" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>16</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="24" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>24</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> hours in the presence of <math alttext="I L 19" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>IL-19</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(c) Based on the data for the <math alttext="48" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>48</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>-hour period, describe the effect of <math alttext="I L 19" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>IL-19</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> on <math alttext="F X R 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi><mi>X</mi><mi mathvariant="italic">R</mi><mtext mathvariant="italic">1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> gene expression.

(d) The researcher hypothesizes that the <math alttext="F X R 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi><mi>X</mi><mi mathvariant="italic">R</mi><mn mathvariant="italic">1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> gene codes for a protein that binds to <math alttext="m R N A’s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>mRNAs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> that encode some of the proteins that damage arteries. Individuals with a particular mutation of the <math alttext="F X R 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><mi>F</mi><mi>X</mi><mi>R</mi><mtext>1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> gene tend to have high levels of these proteins. Based on this information, predict how the <math alttext="F X R 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>FXR1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> protein most likely interacts with the <math alttext="m R N A’s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>mRNAs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
